items.title: Live: Can Nifty rebound after slipping below 200-DMA? | Britannia, GMR Airports in focus | Opening Bell
items.description: Indian benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex ended another session lower yesterday, with Nifty clocking its longest losing streak since February 2023. IT stocks were the top underperformers, while metal stocks bucked the trend. Experts now eye Nifty's resistance at 23,600, with support placed around 23,200. This morning global cues are mixed. Wall Street closed mixed overnight with Tesla shares gaining on reports that President-elect Donald Trump easing regulations on self-driving vehicles. Asia-Pacific markets, meanwhile, opened this morning largely higher. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Britannia, Waaree Energies, and GMR Airports. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Nilesh Jain, Head AVP- Derivative and Technical Research, Centrum Broking and Sandeep Bagla, CEO, TRUST Mutual Fund.

items.title: Home First Finance| Consistent performance driven by solid execution| Stock Analysis
items.description: Home First is growing its loan book consistently, backed by buoyant demand from tier 2/3 cities and strong policy thrust. The company’s execution has been consistently better than its peers and it is well-positioned to capture the significant opportunity in the affordable housing segment. The low-cost housing sector will be a key focus area of the government, and Home First will stand to benefit, given robust loan growth and stable asset quality.

items.title: Shilpa Medicare shares rise 6% on CEP approvals from EDQM
items.description: The first CEP was, received on November 18, was for Octreotide, a synthetic peptide manufactured via solid-phase synthesis. The second CEP approval, received on November 19, was for Nifedipine, an active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) classified as a calcium-channel blocker.

items.title: Urban growth isn’t slowing down; we’re simply looking at the wrong data, says CLSA's Aditya Sonam
items.description: Consumers in metro cities are opting for quick-commerce and e-commerce platforms over traditional FMCG channels. If urban consumption was truly slowing, concert ticket sales and fast fashion would not be thriving as they currently are, Sonam said.

Investor sentiment took a hit following reports of Ukrainian armed forces launching their first ATACMS missile strike in a border region within Russian territory.

items.title: CGD Stocks Like IGL & MGL Tumble 40% Since October; Should You Buy or Stay Away?
items.description: City gas, once a highly promising sector with a clear edge over traditional fuels due to its pricing advantages, has now become one of the most challenging spaces. The government has slashed supplies of cheaper domestically produced natural gas to CNG retailers for the second time since October. Back then, supplies were cut by over 20%, and now, another 20% reduction has been implemented. This shift will significantly increase the raw material costs for city gas distributors. This would take a toll on earnings and squeeze margins for companies like IGL & MGL. Are these just short-term challenges or will this have a long-term impact? Should you invest in these stocks or avoid them completely? Watch this video to know more
